betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Crop Breeder is a new single-block machine that allows players to breed new crops deterministically. It will consume two seeds (the parents), some sort of fertilizer and an optional catalyst item for material-based plants. (usually a block of the material for ore-related crops)

It uses enriched liquid fertilizer to breed crops.
The cost is 1000L per tier of the offspring crop + 500L for each start point the new seed will have (it uses the average of the parents).
So a 31/31/31 tier 5 offspring would cost 51KL to breed.

The capacity should ensure that high-stat crop breeding using the breeder requires at least an HV breeding machine due to its fluid capacity. (It should be fine for those who can breed crops manually, since breeding machine-locked crops start appearing in HV).
The base recipe time is 20 seconds and increases based on the tier of the material the crop outputs.
The power usage to breed any specific crop is based on its output materials.
Ididine, osmianth and stargtatium are all IV recipes, Titania is EV, and Bauxia is MV.
Because the seed duplicator exists, I plan to have it eat the seeds if breeding fails.
Bred crops will always have stats that are the average of their parents; breeding two maxed-out crops will always give a maxed-out offspring.
Success chance starts at 50% and increases by 10% for every tier past MV, meaning that at ZPM, it’s guaranteed. 
With bees, having enough tubes and/or maddening frames will guarantee the breeding even at earlier stages, so I’m fine with starting it with a higher chance, given that you can’t speed up the process at the minimum tier.

[warn]If anybody makes it so there is no way to guarantee an output later on, I will teach you why the Canadians are responsible for a good chunk of the Geneva Convention. The hate I have for my luck is not to be underestimated. 
For context: The first time I tried the success chance after implementing it, I failed 16 times in a row with a 50% chance.[/warn]
